data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 4 steps backwards. Steps forward can be taken in 4 directions. Steps left can be taken in 4 directions. Steps right can be taken in 4 directions. Steps backward can be taken in 4 directions. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The directions are the same for the right side and you revert to the starting point so you must revert to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Take 4 steps once you have returned to the starting point. Take 6 steps once you have taken 6 steps. Take 4 steps once you have turned around. Take 10 steps once you have turned around. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

When you are one step forward into the change, you are 1 step backward. Since 7 is different from 5, you need to take 1 step forward into the change to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around, you don't return to the starting point. You must take 5 steps to return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can’ t turn around and then turn around at the same time. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn right, you will return to the starting point (which is the end). So, the answer is Yes.

Take 6 steps to return to the starting point. Turnaround 8 steps to return to the starting point. Take 2 steps to take 2 steps to return to the starting point. No steps to return to the beginning point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
As you move forward, you must always face forward for any movement. Even putting one step left makes it clear that you are not going back. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 2 steps. If you turn around the instructions would say take 2 steps. You can see in the two  steps '' instructions there are three steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Step back is backward and forward is forward so the first step backward is to step in the direction that they are facing forward and the second step backward is to step in the direction that they are facing backward. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you take 6 steps backwards, you take 6 steps backwards in steps 4 - 7. Take 8 steps right. You take 8 steps right in steps 4 - 7. If you take 1 step backward, you take 1 step backward in steps 5 - 8. If you take 2 steps left, you take 2 steps left in steps 2 - 8. If you always face forward, you take 6 steps backwards in steps 4 - 7. So, the answer is No.

The directions are same for each step. They are only for the left side. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you always go forward. The final answer: Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Taking 1 step backward does not return you to the starting point and the total number of steps taken will always be 0. This way you always start from facing forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turning around and turning left adds 2 steps to the total. To return to the start point the left has to be the same as the left. Similarly the right has to be the same as the right. So, the answer is yes.

To turn around, we need to have 9 steps. We need to turn around, then take 3 steps. So, the answer is No.

Take 3 steps to go 2 blocks. Take 3 steps to go 2 blocks. Take 2 steps to turn around. Turn right. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around 1: It is the second step to turn right. Take 7 steps and turn left 1: It is the eighth step to turn right. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn right and take 1 step.Take 5 steps. Take 1 step.Take 3 steps. Turn right and take 5 steps. Take 1 step.Take 2 steps. Turn right. So, the answer is No.

You can return to the starting point only after you are back in the original position. So, the answer is yes.

Before you turn around and return to the starting point, each step has to be taken again. So, the answer is Yes.

If you turn around you will get back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

When you face forward, your steps go forward. In the example, to return to the starting point: To take 7 steps forward, you should take 8 steps left. To take 7 steps right is to take 7 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.

A person who always faces forward is only half way across the room. When he goes backward he must return to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

Turning around and taking 4 steps are the same thing. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward you will return to the beginning point. Thus, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point could be at the next intersection. Turning around doesn’t result in returning to the starting point, rather it leads to another location. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you take more steps forward than when going backward. If you take 3 steps backward, the second set of steps is repeated, while the first step is repeated. If you back up once, you do so 5x, 1X, and the second set repeats, while the first set is repeated 5x, 1X, and the other sets repeats. Therefore, the answer is Yes.

If you take 4 steps, the number of steps to get you to the starting point is 4. If you follow the instructions of the 3 steps with a 1 that are taken to get you back to the starting point then there are 4 steps taken. So, the answer is Yes.

The turning point is on the opposite side of the road of the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

Take 2 steps forward. Take one step back.

There are two ways to take 5 steps backward and 4 steps backward. So, the answer is no.

You always face forward in the forward direction. The number of steps backward are the steps that each step in the forward direction is taken. To take 4 steps right, one must first take 4 steps. The number of steps backward is 4 steps. If you are to take 6 steps left, you first take 6 steps left then 6 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.

Let A be the starting point. Take 2 steps. Take 8 steps. Take 10 steps. Take A. So, the answer is no.

Walking to the previous location won’t leave you til you return to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

Five steps equal to 5 steps. 7 steps equals 7 steps. 10 steps equals 10 steps. The answer: Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 7 steps left. Take 4 steps backward. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

One must always face forward for 6 steps backward to get one back to the starting point. This is because if one wants to return to the beginning, they take 6 steps backward from the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If we are facing forward we should take 3 steps back. If we are facing backward we should take 3 steps backward. If we are facing forward we should take 2 steps backward. So, the answer is Yes.

Turning right will take 10 steps. Turning right takes 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

In the instructions, always face forward. The directions tell you to always start in the forward direction. The answer: yes.

Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In the direction you started facing forward, the first place you should take your first steps is always the front of the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

All steps taken in sequence return to the starting point. If you retrace the sequence 5 times starting from the right, you still face forward. There are 5 steps to proceed. So, the answer is no.

Turning left takes a total of 9 steps. Turning right takes 3 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you look straight up, you will not always go back. On the contrary, you will only return to the starting point once you reverse your direction. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 5 steps backward. Take 2 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To go backward, you take 5 steps backward. To go forward, you take 2 steps forward. In these directions, there is always 4 steps left and 5 steps backward. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps backward. Take 8 steps backward. Take 10 steps forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 1 step forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 1 step left. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

At first, you are pointed away from the start. In fact, you will take one step forward toward the start-point. Then, you will take seven steps backwards again. So, you take 7 steps backwards. Therefore, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 10 steps right. Take 4 steps forward. Take 1 step left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face and always face forward, you could always make it to the starting point. If you always face and always face forward, it can only be the first step. So, the answer is yes.
